lines.gurmukhi: kaufw pYsw rupeIAw suneIAw ko bnj krY rqn pwrKu hoie jauhrI khwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Kaudaa Paisaa Roupaeeaa Sounaeeaa Ko Banaj Karai , Ratan Paarakhu Hoi Jauharee Kahaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as one starts dealing in shells in the beginning, then in money, gold coins and then becomes evaluator of diamonds and precious stones. He is then called a jeweller.

lines.gurmukhi: jauhrI khwie pun kaufw ko bnju krY pMc prvwn mY pqistw GtwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Jauharee Kahaai Poun Kaudaa Ko Banaju Karai , Panch Paravaan Mai Patasitaa Ghataavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: But after becoming famous as a jeweller, one starts dealing in shells, he loses his respect among the elite people.

lines.gurmukhi: Awn dyv syv gurdyv ko syvk huie lok prlok ibKY aUc pdu pwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Aan Dayv Sayv Gurdayv Ko Sayvak Hui , Lok Paralok Bikhai Ooch Padu Paavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, if a follower of some god comes into the service of True Guru, he acquires high status in this and the world beyond.

lines.gurmukhi: Cwif gurdyv syv Awn dyv syvk huie inhPl jnmu kpUq huie hswveI ]479]
lines.transliteration_english: Chhaadi Gurdayv Sayv Aan Dayv Sayvak Hui , Nihadhal Janamu Kapoot Hui Hasaavaee ?479?

Shabad OS B.translation: But if someone leaves the service of the True Guru, and becomes a follower of some other god, then he wastes away his human life and he is laughed at by others being known as a bad son.  (479)
